revised_title: Characteristics and Behavior of Detonation-Generated Plasmas
tldr: The authors present photographic sequences of highly ionized gas clouds, or detonation-generated plasmas, emitted from the free surfaces of detonating explosives. They discuss the extrusion, compression, and expansion effects of these plasmas, as well as their associated shock patterns and conductivity-density relationships. The study reveals that detonation-generated plasmas are characteristic of detonation in all condensed high explosives and have a metallic-like character.
